title: Russell Crowe is creating a new horror movie with the writer of Scream
text:
Russell Crowe will star in a new horror film which he’s creating with the writer and producer of Scream (Picture: Getty Images for AFI)

Russell Crowe has teamed up with Scream writer Kevin Williamson for a new supernatural horror film.

The Oscar winner has joined the Miramax movie, which is doesn’t have a title yet, and will portray a troubled actor who begins to unravel whilst he is shooting a horror film.

His estranged daughter begins to worry that her father is slipping back into his past addictions or if whether something more sinister could be at play.

A creepy film about a creepy film, you love to see it!

M.A. Fortin and Joshua John Miller – who were responsible for creating 2015 comedy/slasher film ‘The Final Girls’ – have written the screenplay and they’ll be making their directorial debut on the project too.

The film will be produced by Kevin, who has worked on The Following and The Vampire Diaries, for his Outerbanks company alongside Miramax’s Bill Block.

The actor recently starred in The Loudest Voice where he transformed into former Fox News CEO Roger Ailes

‘Bill and I are so excited to work with Russell, one of the greatest actors of our time,’ Kevin said about the project.

‘Fortin and Miller have such a fresh vision for this film, we know that together they will create something memorable.’

Russell, 55, recently wrapped production on road rage thriller Unhinged so he’s on a bit of a thriller movie roll at the moment.

Meanwhile he’s recently starred in The True History of the Gary Kelly Gang and played the late Fox News boss Roger Ailes in The Loudest Voice.
